cards.name: The User Need
cards.uprightMeaning: Clear user pain point, validated demand, strong product-market fit signals
cards.reversedMeaning: Assumed need without validation, building for yourself not users, solution looking for a problem

cards.name: The Market Timing
cards.uprightMeaning: Perfect timing, market ready for innovation, early mover advantage
cards.reversedMeaning: Too early or too late, market not ready, missed the window

cards.name: The Technical Path
cards.uprightMeaning: Achievable with current tech, clear implementation path, scalable architecture
cards.reversedMeaning: Technical debt ahead, over-engineered solution, unsustainable complexity

cards.name: The Resources
cards.uprightMeaning: Sufficient budget and team, right skills available, sustainable burn rate
cards.reversedMeaning: Resource constraints, skill gaps, unsustainable spending

cards.name: The Competition
cards.uprightMeaning: Clear differentiation, defensible moat, unique value proposition
cards.reversedMeaning: Crowded market, commoditized offering, no clear advantage

cards.name: The Alignment
cards.uprightMeaning: Leadership buy-in, team consensus, clear shared vision
cards.reversedMeaning: Conflicting priorities, political resistance, misaligned incentives

cards.name: The Experience
cards.uprightMeaning: Intuitive design, delightful interactions, solves user friction
cards.reversedMeaning: Confusing interface, poor usability, creates new problems

cards.name: The Launch
cards.uprightMeaning: Clear distribution strategy, strong positioning, effective messaging
cards.reversedMeaning: Unclear channels, weak positioning, poor market fit

cards.name: The Metrics
cards.uprightMeaning: Strong signals in data, clear success metrics, measurable impact
cards.reversedMeaning: Vanity metrics, unclear KPIs, data doesn't support hypothesis

cards.name: The Voice
cards.uprightMeaning: Enthusiastic early adopters, positive feedback loops, organic advocacy
cards.reversedMeaning: Lukewarm reception, feature requests diverge, churn signals

cards.name: The Pivot
cards.uprightMeaning: Flexibility to adapt, learning from failures, iterative improvement
cards.reversedMeaning: Locked into wrong direction, sunk cost fallacy, resistance to change

cards.name: The Team
cards.uprightMeaning: Right expertise, strong execution, collaborative culture
cards.reversedMeaning: Skill mismatches, execution gaps, team dysfunction

cards.name: The Vision
cards.uprightMeaning: Clear roadmap, sustainable strategy, long-term value creation
cards.reversedMeaning: Short-term thinking, no clear direction, unsustainable model

cards.name: The Risk
cards.uprightMeaning: Calculated risks, mitigation strategies, acceptable downside
cards.reversedMeaning: Unmanaged risks, blind spots, catastrophic failure potential

cards.name: The Integration
cards.uprightMeaning: Smooth integration, compatible systems, minimal disruption
cards.reversedMeaning: Integration hell, incompatible systems, major technical debt

cards.name: The Compliance
cards.uprightMeaning: Clear regulatory path, manageable compliance, legal clarity
cards.reversedMeaning: Regulatory uncertainty, compliance burden, legal risks

cards.name: The Scale
cards.uprightMeaning: Built to scale, efficient growth path, sustainable unit economics
cards.reversedMeaning: Scaling challenges, inefficient growth, broken unit economics

cards.name: The Innovation
cards.uprightMeaning: Novel approach, breakthrough potential, paradigm shift
cards.reversedMeaning: Incremental improvement, me-too feature, no real innovation

cards.name: The Retention
cards.uprightMeaning: Strong retention, habit-forming, high lifetime value
cards.reversedMeaning: High churn, one-time use, low engagement

cards.name: The Monetization
cards.uprightMeaning: Clear revenue path, willing-to-pay customers, sustainable pricing
cards.reversedMeaning: Unclear monetization, price resistance, unsustainable model
